page.title: 12CANAL LIFE IN WORCESTERSHIRE
page.content: Canal life is an important part of the canal.The canal forms the base of the{community}life. It encourages {sports}such as canoeing,boating, fishing and also walking. There are many types of fish such as Bream, Roach,Pike.This water is excellent for placid water canoeing and very good for marathon training. Boating is very pleasant, because of the abundance of flora and fauna. There are many species of animals e.g. Voles,Rabbits, Mice,and many birds which live near the waterside. One hundred and fifty years ago the canal was a hive of activity with barges carrying coal,iron,grain and other goods between Worcester and Birmingham.Today the only activity is from leisure craft,fishermen and walkers as they enjoy the peaceful scenery.
